alert.note: Alert for Pueblo (Colorado) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flash Flood Warning issued July 26 at 7:25PM MDT until July 26 at 8:15PM MDT by NWS Pueblo
info.description: ...FLASH FLOOD WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 815 PM MDT THIS EVENING FOR NORTH CENTRAL PUEBLO COUNTY... At 725 PM MDT, Trained weather spotters reported flowing water over many roads up to 1 foot deep across southeast Pueblo West. Additionally, there are reports of stranded and submerged cars with streets closed due to high water on the northwest side of Pueblo near Platteville Boulevard. Between 3 and 4 inches of rain have fallen, though thunderstorms with heavy rain have ended at this time. Flash flooding is already occurring. HAZARD...Life threatening flash flooding. Thunderstorms producing flash flooding. SOURCE...Trained spotters reported. IMPACT...Life threatening flash flooding of creeks and streams, urban areas, highways, streets and underpasses. Some locations that will experience flash flooding include... Pueblo, Pueblo West, Salt Creek, Pueblo Reservoir and Blende. FLASH FLOOD...OBSERVED FLASH FLOOD DAMAGE THREAT...CONSIDERABLE
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Be especially cautious at night when it is harder to recognize the dangers of flooding.
